title: I Don't Think Ajuna Mugged The Whistling Man
body: From the comic, we see that the man, after saying he got what was coming to him, says that he was trying to steal from him, and he pulls out his gun to show that he attempted to steal his gun. He then shoots, making me think he's just some crazy guy who wants to shoot the next kid who comes to him.

replies.body: From what i've seen and read zaun is extremely loose on rules and laws. Personally I wouldn't take any chances if i was cornered in an alley by some angry kid wielding a glowing weapon of some sort.

These comments are based on the assumption that the man is telling the truth of "He tried to steal this from me."

It's possible the man only said "He tried to steal this..." because he was pulling out the weapon to shoot Ekko.  No, I won't blame the guy for trying to defend himself. Some kid came out of nowhere possibly trying to mug him.


HOWEVER, this guy just shot a kid and was WHISTLING!  I don't care about the circumstances that Piltie found himself in. He was whistling Dixie after shooting someone and leaving them for dead.  If you consider Ajuna or Ekko the bad guy in that situation, then you obviously don't get the concept of what it's like living in the gutter.

If he was sobbing up a storm and cradling the poor kid after realizing the shot was fatal, then he would have been a sympathetic character.

Shame he lived. Glad Ekko didn't go through with it in the end, but that whistling dick escaped any form of justice. Hope he has a slip of tongue around Vi or something, because I know she knows where to draw the line... and how to make it as painful as possible.

Yup.

Wow, forgot about the whistling. You really make a good point with that.

I know this thread is 4 months old and all, but I gotta say, I think Ajuna probably didn't try to mug the guy, but rather tried to pick-pocket him. Considering his small size, and... Well... His age, he doesn't pose much of a threat to a full grown man. 
It could explain why he didn't get a good look at the guy because he snuck up on him from behind.

Even in that case shouldn't ajuna have seen the clothes of the guy?
I mean saying "it was a guy in a blue coat with a top-hat" sounds way more accurate than "some whistling dude",especially since the person could stop whistling whenever they want.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenLore,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=Vefq4Rhc,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2015-09-04T08:34:09.858+0000)

> I mean saying "it was a guy in a blue coat with a top-hat" sounds way more accurate than "some whistling dude",especially since the person could stop whistling whenever they want.

D: you think the guy just walked over and beat him up?!

He probably saw ajuna and shot him(he had a gun,so I assume he simply shot ajuna instead of beating him up) for some reason.

There are multiple possible reasons for why he could have done,for example he might have seen ajuna stealing something,or he thought that ajuna heard something that the guy wanted to keep a secret or some other small offense that ajuna did without even realizing.
In the worst case scenario the guy was just evil and killed ajuna for fun.

Also worth mentioning Ajuna didnt know a single feature of that man.

Literally the only info he had to give Ekko was that he whistles. Ajuna had no idea what he actually looked like.

This suggests Ajuna was the one that got attacked.

Well, considering that Zaun is a really dangerous place, were you can be randomly selected as guinea pig for experiments, killed by robots, attacked by giant rats and mutants, eaten by a random dragon, punched by cyborgs, exploded by random bombs, even the air can kill you, etc... i don't blame the guy for carrying a loaded gun with him. 

But... killing a 12 years boy because he tried to steal something? geez that is extreme... but then again, there are almost 0 laws at Zauns... so, if you are not going to defend your self... no one else will.

> But... killing a 12 years boy because he tried to steal something?

Do note that he was killed by a boy of roughly the same age. The years one has lived is no measure of how deadly a person can be.

> Do note that he was killed by a boy of roughly the same age. The years one has lived is no measure of how deadly a person can be.

Technically, no.  When the man shot Ekko's Z-drive it was either "kill him" or go see his friend one more time.  He chose to be there for his friend's final moments.  After that, he had to fix the Z-drive.
Couldn't he just cut his throat  THEN go see his friend?

When it's your last run, sometimes you just don't have time for both (or can't risk a slip-up).

Priorities, mate.

During the the Q&A, one of the rioters said this:

>Zaun might be a rough place, but Ekko isn't a killer at heart. A blunt weapon gives him what he needs, without the deadly side-effects.

Well, Ekko has 16 - 17 years aprox according to the QaA... anyways it could be a past memory... and Ekko was armed, Ajuna was not.
Ajuna wanted to get some food for his friend. To get food you need money or the actual food, when he sought out in that man, unfortunately the guy was prepared if someone tried to mug him.
